oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pros and Cons of Exporting Australian Avif auna
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Carlisle, Denis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Abstract In the following paper I will explain the associated problems involved in the capture and exporting of pest species of birds. My presentation will be in five parts: • a brief outline of Australia; • the benefits of exporting birds, including revenue derived; • crop damage and trapping; • smuggling of Australian birds; and • the role of dealers and trappers. Introduction Many of the world's 8500 species of birds are now kept in captivity, and the ancestry of a number of the more spectacularly coloured species of these birds can be traced back to Australia. Most people have heard of this island continent of ours. Quite a number of you may have even visited Australia. For those not familiar with this "landdown-under" I have included the following.
